value.name: Man facing assault, attempting to elude police charges in Lawton
value.description: A man is facing charges after being accused of pointing a gun at a person and try Lawton police. According to the affidavit, Michael Rogers was looking under the hood of his truck in the driveway of the victim’s girlfriend.

video.name: Man facing assault, attempting to elude police charges in Lawton

value.name: Burning of the Custom House: Some Dublin firefighters played a significant role by intentionally spreading the blaze
value.description: SET ABLAZE ON this day 100 years ago, the Custom House burned for a full ten days. That was in spite of being attended by a Fire Brigade that had already been proven to be competent and well-resourced and also in spite of being surrounded on two sides by large bodies of water and on the other by perfectly efficient fire hydrants.

value.name: Bureaucratic Block at State Level Causes Summit Council to Postpone City Budget Vote
value.description: SUMMIT, NJ - Meeting via Zoom for what is anticipated to be its last 'hybrid' gathering, now that pandemic restrictions are being eased by the state of New Jersey, the City of Summit Common Council postponed a vote on the 2021 Municipal Budget due to the fact the state has not appointed a reviewer for the budget.

value.name: Horseheads Kiwanis presents awards to police officers
value.description: As part of National Police Week, the Horseheads Kiwanis club recently presented its 22nd annual Police Officers of the Year awards to officers.

value.name: New Testimonials by Occupy LA Detainees Suggest Illegal Arrests, Abuse, Even Torture by LAPD, LASD
value.description: Many of the individuals who were swept up by last week's LAPD raid on the Occupy LA encampment at Los Angeles City Hall were arrested even as they attempted to disperse in accordance with police directives, according to testimonials from some who were ...

value.name: Federal Judge in Don Siegelman Case Arrested, Charged with Abusing Wife in Atlanta Hotel
